item.description:
I'm planning to visit Maine for multiple day hikes. Let's hike to several High Peaks in Maine together!!
The mountains which I highlighted in red are listed in NE 4K footers and in blue are listed as NE HH (New England 100 Highest).

This is cross posted event from my own hiking meetup - Hike/Snowshoe Vermont Meetup.



This is Day-2 hiking event description to peakbag 2 particular mountains, Saddleback Mountain (4120 ft) and The Horn (4041 ft) at Southeast of Rangeley. The bare summit of both offer far-flung views in all directions. However, high winds and restricted visibility can be dangerous and trail is difficult to follow in bad weather since its widespread areas are above treeline.
You can join us only one of my Maine hiking events or all which is up to you.

Hiking Plan:

1) This is round trip hike which doesn't require car spot.
We'll meet at the parking lot of Saddleback Ski Area on Saddleback Mountain Road, Rangeley, ME at 7:00AM. Many people may choose to hike on AT because these 2 mountains are on it, however, this event uses ski trails to hike in to Saddleback from northwestern side such that we can save a couple of hiking mileage.

2) We'll start hike at 7:15AM sharp. Here is my brief plan to take multiple ski trails.
Please take a look at the hiking description with the Saddleback Ski Trail map for your reference.

* After park our cars at the parking lot, we pass near the Lodge, take Wheeler to hike in.
* Gray Ghost
* The Pass
* Jitterbug
* Hudson Highway
* Tri-Color to summit of Saddleback, then, to AT to peakbag The Horn.
* We'll return with the same path to the parking lot.




Hiking Level:
Moderate
Hiking Distance: I don't know the accurate mileage since we'll use ski trails. I assume the distance will be less than 14 miles round trip.
Hiking Pace: Slow to Moderate
Hiking Hours: 8 hours + Lunch 30min + Break Time (Of course, hiking hours varies depending on your hiking pace)



Suggested Meetup Locations:

1) We'll meet at the parking lot of Saddleback ski area at 7AM. (See the above link to see Saddleback ski area). The parking lot is located at the right hand side from the Lodge on this map. I assume the Parking lot is located South side from the Lodge, although I've never been there.

2) I booked Town & Lake Motel in Rangeley to stay 9/9 night. You can stay at Maine Roadhouse which si a bit far but cheap. (40-50min drive to the trailhead, Bunk room is $20 per night) This is about 20-25 min away from the trailhead by car. We can possibly meet there at 6:35AM.

Main Roadhouse
910 Rangeley Rd
Stratton, ME

Other nearby locations to stay overnight:
* Stratton Motel http://www.thestratto...
* Gull Pond Lodge, 8min from Saddleback ski area 207-864-5563
* Farmhouse Inn, Rangeley ME 207-864-5805
* Town & Lake Motel and Cottages, 112 Main St, Rangeley, ME 207-864-3755
* Loon Lodge, 309 Pickford Rd, Rangeley, ME 207-864-5666


This is the google map from Maine Roadhouse to Saddleback Ski area.



If you have any questions, please feel free to drop me an email.

Event Organizer,
Tomoko Nakajima
item.name: Multiple Day-Hiking Events in Maine - Day 2: Saddleback Mtn & The Horn
